column2: bigrd2015@aol.com, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: While I am taking this medication with IBU800 to relieve a right shoulder muscle strain, I am not feeling the relieve I would usually get any other time I have been on Percocet 5/325.  This particular medication I am taking has a 54-543 on the one side of the pill and a 'pill cutter' mark on the other side of the pill.  When I look up the actual pill description, it comes up as Roxicet; another brand name for Percocet.  In all my six years as being a Pharmacy Technician for Rite Aid Corporation I have never seen a brand name used to describe another brand named drug which is the same.  Example:  If you are taking Glucophage XR 500...THE PILL BOTTLE SAYS THIS --- If you are taking Metformin ER 500/Metformin XR 500, the bottle is marked accordingly with a small printed message below this name on the bottle stating it is considered a generic type version or another version of the brand name drug Glucophage XR 500.  This particular Roxicet was never mentioned on my pill bottle no where, but actual has this formulation of medication in the bottle based on the 'pill identifier' description.  It actually has Oxycodone/Acet++ with the actual BRAND NAME BELOW IT OF PERCOCET.  THIS LABELING PROCEDURE HAS TO BE INCORRECT AT BEST!!! MORE ON THIS LATER AS I DISCOVER AND INVESTIGATE WHAT IS ACTUALLY GOING ON IN THE UNITY PHARMACY SITES HERE IN WASHINGTON, DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, AND MY MEDICATIONS.

column2: Ayellowmimi, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Just started taking Roxicet today because of strep throat, a secondary throat infection, and an ear infection. My throat hurts so badly that when I talk I have been told I sound like a special needs person.  Roxicet does NOT take my pain away, it just kind of makes it more bearable. I have found that it does not last me the 6hrs that it is supposed to, wearing off after about 4.  This could maybe be due to the fact that I haven't been able to eat in four days, or because mine is a liquid prescription (so I can actually swallow it). Only thing I can say for it is it starts working for me within 5 min, and it has caused me no drowsiness so far.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
cc, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: I by accident came across the most generous dr and he started giving me roxicet 30 mg after I told him Lortab stopped working for me. He gave me 150 pills at 30mg and said to take up 2 5 a day. Next thing you know I start withdrawals after 2 hrs. So I got up to 10 a day. I do not have a addictve behavior nor depression. Im very happy and successful and these pills almost killed me. I realized I had to go cold turkey due to the fact that you cant cut down when your body needs them. I became very moody and angry. It stopped working on pain and I had to take them just to get normal otherwise deathly sick. So when I stopped I had to go to hospital twice because I couldnt keep fluids down and vomited everything. They gave me blood thinners to help with the withdrawals. Bottom line you still have to deal with severe withdrawals for anywhere from 3-10 days. I think it took me at least 2 months to feel right. My doctor is currently being investigated on 5 deaths due to this due. One lady had severe constipation from drug for 3 weeks her insides blew up from sepsia. One more thing roxicets really mess with your respiratory system. There were many nights I couldnt catch breath and thought I was gonna die. Please be very careful on this medicine and make sure your having bowel movements or take meds for proper bowels.

column2: azace, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I take 8 15 mg tabs per day for chronic back pain for several months.  I started with 5mg oxycodone with tylenol 4/day 4 years ago, increasing regularly to 10 mg 8/day and now to roxicet 15mg with no tylenol 8/day.  The relief starts after about 30 minutes and lasts about 3-5 hours, depending on what I'm doing (my mind is busy or just waiting for the next pill!).  After that I get anxiety, sneezing, nausea, and restlessness until my next dose. I can go up to 12 hours from my last dose at night until I wake up.  The pill works best with something to eat.I don't get any drowsiness except sometimes on a long drive, but I also take neurontin, which deoes create drowsiness.  I take 1200 mg before I go to bed to help me get through the night without waking. All in all roxicet works well, but you always have to keep increasing the doseage when you get used to it.
